ygData.subject: Re: invisable and see invisable
ygData.msgSnippet: Just as a sort of I second the motion comment. Yes, the other replier is correct. You can cast see invis and you should be able to see yourself. Also
ygData.messageBody:
Just as a sort of "I second the motion" comment.
Yes, the other replier is correct. <br><br>You can
cast see invis and you should be able to see yourself.
Also cast see invis on other members of your party
before you invis the party. It's a good idea to cast it
on yourself first so that you know when either is
fading.<br><br>Animals can usually not see through invis. Undead always.
High level NPC's or NPC's that cast see invis on
themselves will see you (sometimes it's a percent
chance).<br><br>There is a spell called Invis to Undead though that
some casters get. Those work against Undead only. I
don't know if it stacks with normal invis. Camo
(druid/ranger version of invis) does not work indoors. Neither
unfortunately, does SOW. (Lucky bards... lol. I love those ppl.
They cover my behind-- which is darned
ugly).<br><br>Best thing to do is invis yourself and ALWAY con
something before you get too close if you've never been
invis around it before. You know your invis works if
they state that they're indifferent to you. Sometimes,
I con just to be safe against something dangerous
b/c I have had times for some reason, that the invis
worked once but not the second time through an area with
the same mob (but only while my div was really low.
It's in the 55 or so range now and hasn't been
inconsistant for a while though).<br><br>Sorry to be so long
winded. Hope this helped.<br><br>shooman out<br>Fatedhue
Prismatic of the Drinal Server
